column4: Does Ubuntu work out of the box with Acer Laptops' wireless lan that have hard-switches? My Wireless card is an Intel Wireless 2200B/G
ipw2200 is very well supported in linux at least
but I think you need to download the firmware yourself as it's not allowed to redistribute it

and frying_fish: but the problem is that my laptop has a hardswitch for the wireless card that is turned off by default on the computers startup. I have had problems other with Linux distributions not detecting the hardswitch
